subject: Re: [junit] test to see if the output is a string or an interger
msgSnippet: This is probably just a plain-ole java question... I think what you re looking for is simply something this: public void testBlah() { String stringUnderTest =
messageBody:
This is probably just a plain-ole java question...

I think what you're looking for is simply something this:

public void testBlah()
{
String stringUnderTest = ???;

try {
java.lang.Integer.parseInt(stringUnderTest);
}
catch(NumberFormatException nfe) {
// stringUnderTest isn't an int, therefore we passed

return; // <-- exit the test method; we're OK
}

fail("stringUnderTest '"+stringUnderTest+"' was numeric);
}

Of course this is a complete guess on my end; It its not what you had in
mind; send in a code example :)

Regards,
Levi
